entry.tran: （声音或言辞）甜蜜的，悦耳的;（尤指）虚伪的，阿谀的
entry.def: You can describe some-one's voice or words as honeyed when they are very pleasant to listen to, especially if you want to suggest that they are insincere.

example.ex: His gentle manner and honeyed tones reassured Andrew...
example.tran: 他温和的态度和悦耳的语调使安德鲁消除了疑虑。

example.ex: They could not understand how anyone could believe her honeyed words.
example.tran: 他们无法理解怎么会有人相信她的甜言蜜语。

entry.def: You can describe something as honeyed when it tastes or smells of honey, or is the pale yellowish colour of honey.

example.ex: I could smell the honeyed ripeness of melons and peaches.
example.tran: 我能闻到瓜桃熟透了的香甜味道。

sentences.en: Honeyed words may deceive people of some time,but they cannot stand the test of time and practice.
sentences.cn: 花言巧语蒙骗人于一时,但是却经不起时间和实践的检验。
